intro: Buchnera dundensis, commonly known as the Dundee bugloss, is a flowering plant native to the British Isles. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Buchnera dundensis has small, hairy leaves and produces flowers in early summer. It is a relatively rare species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
